availability.p: All research and writing of Civil War Governors of Kentucky Digital Documentary Edition annotations was undertaken by project staff, volunteers, and interns. Each record contains citations to relevant primary and secondary source material. All annotations are copyright Kentucky Historical Society, and should be referenced as such in any published work.

seriesStmt.title: Civil War Governors of Kentucky Digital Documentary Edition

body.p: Trigg County, Kentucky, farmer. Trigg County, Kentucky, native. Son of Starkie Thomas and Mary "Polly" Bridges Thomas. Married to Eliza Martin Thomas in Trigg County, Kentucky, on March 29, 1863. Father of Ida Thomas. Farmer in Trigg County, Kentucky, in 1850. Household owned fifteen enslaved persons in Trigg County in 1850.

ab.bibl:
Seventh Manuscript Census of the United States (1850), Population Schedules, Kentucky, Trigg County, District 2, p. 353B-354A.
Seventh Manuscript Census of the United States (1850), Slave Schedules, Kentucky, Trigg County, District 2.
Ninth Manuscript Census of the United States (1870), Population Schedules, Kentucky, Trigg County, Cadiz Precinct, p. 5B.
Kentucky, County Marriages, 1797-1954, Genealogical Society of Salt Lake City, Salt Lake City, UT, Trigg County Marriages, Film 000321335.
Sons of the American Revolution Membership Applications, 1889-1970, National Society of the Sons of the American Revolution, Louisville, KY, National 91877, State 1177.
David Sumner, Kim Fortner, Pam Metts, and Charles Morris, Cemeteries of Cadiz and Trigg County, Kentucky (Sumforme Publishing, 2008), 330.
